46static void avivo_crtc_load_lut(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
47{
48 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
49 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
50 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
51 int i;
52
53 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%d\n", radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
54 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
55
56 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_BLACK_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
57 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_BLACK_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
58 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_BLACK_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
59
60 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_WHITE_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
61 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_WHITE_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
62 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUTA_WHITE_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
63
64 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUT_RW_SELECT, radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
65 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUT_RW_MODE, 0);
66 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUT_WRITE_EN_MASK, 0x0000003f);
67
68 WREG8(AVIVO_DC_LUT_RW_INDEX, 0);
69 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
70 WREG32(AVIVO_DC_LUT_30_COLOR,
71 (radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] << 20) |
72 (radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] << 10) |
73 (radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] << 0));
74 }
75
76 /* Only change bit 0 of LUT_SEL, other bits are set elsewhere */
77 WREG32_P(AVIVO_D1GRPH_LUT_SEL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, radeon_crtc->crtc_id, ~1);
78}
79
80static void dce4_crtc_load_lut(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
81{
82 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
83 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
84 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
85 int i;
86
87 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%d\n", radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
88 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
89
90 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
91 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
92 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
93
94 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
95 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
96 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
97
98 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_RW_MODE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
99 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WRITE_EN_MASK + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0x00000007);
100
101 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_RW_INDEX + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
102 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
103 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_30_COLOR + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
104 (radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] << 20) |
105 (radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] << 10) |
106 (radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] << 0));
107 }
108}
109
110static void dce5_crtc_load_lut(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
111{
112 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
113 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
114 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
115 int i;
116
117 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%d\n", radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
118
119 WREG32(NI_INPUT_CSC_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
120 (NI_INPUT_CSC_GRPH_MODE(NI_INPUT_CSC_BYPASS) |
121 NI_INPUT_CSC_OVL_MODE(NI_INPUT_CSC_BYPASS)));
122 WREG32(NI_PRESCALE_GRPH_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
123 NI_GRPH_PRESCALE_BYPASS);
124 WREG32(NI_PRESCALE_OVL_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
125 NI_OVL_PRESCALE_BYPASS);
126 WREG32(NI_INPUT_GAMMA_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
127 (NI_GRPH_INPUT_GAMMA_MODE(NI_INPUT_GAMMA_USE_LUT) |
128 NI_OVL_INPUT_GAMMA_MODE(NI_INPUT_GAMMA_USE_LUT)));
129
130 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
131
132 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
133 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
134 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_BLACK_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
135
136 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_BLUE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
137 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_GREEN + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
138 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WHITE_OFFSET_RED + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0xffff);
139
140 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_RW_MODE + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
141 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_WRITE_EN_MASK + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0x00000007);
142
143 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_RW_INDEX + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
144 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
145 WREG32(EVERGREEN_DC_LUT_30_COLOR + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
146 (radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] << 20) |
147 (radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] << 10) |
148 (radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] << 0));
149 }
150
151 WREG32(NI_DEGAMMA_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
152 (NI_GRPH_DEGAMMA_MODE(NI_DEGAMMA_BYPASS) |
153 NI_OVL_DEGAMMA_MODE(NI_DEGAMMA_BYPASS) |
154 NI_ICON_DEGAMMA_MODE(NI_DEGAMMA_BYPASS) |
155 NI_CURSOR_DEGAMMA_MODE(NI_DEGAMMA_BYPASS)));
156 WREG32(NI_GAMUT_REMAP_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
157 (NI_GRPH_GAMUT_REMAP_MODE(NI_GAMUT_REMAP_BYPASS) |
158 NI_OVL_GAMUT_REMAP_MODE(NI_GAMUT_REMAP_BYPASS)));
159 WREG32(NI_REGAMMA_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
160 (NI_GRPH_REGAMMA_MODE(NI_REGAMMA_BYPASS) |
161 NI_OVL_REGAMMA_MODE(NI_REGAMMA_BYPASS)));
162 WREG32(NI_OUTPUT_CSC_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
163 (NI_OUTPUT_CSC_GRPH_MODE(radeon_crtc->output_csc) |
164 NI_OUTPUT_CSC_OVL_MODE(NI_OUTPUT_CSC_BYPASS)));
165 /* XXX match this to the depth of the crtc fmt block, move to modeset? */
166 WREG32(0x6940 + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset, 0);
167 if (ASIC_IS_DCE8(rdev)) {
168 /* XXX this only needs to be programmed once per crtc at startup,
169 * not sure where the best place for it is
170 */
171 WREG32(CIK_ALPHA_CONTROL + radeon_crtc->crtc_offset,
172 CIK_CURSOR_ALPHA_BLND_ENA);
173 }
174}
175
176static void legacy_crtc_load_lut(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
177{
178 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
179 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
180 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
181 int i;
182 uint32_t dac2_cntl;
183
184 dac2_cntl = RREG32(RADEON_DAC_CNTL2);
185 if (radeon_crtc->crtc_id == 0)
186 dac2_cntl &= (uint32_t)~RADEON_DAC2_PALETTE_ACC_CTL;
187 else
188 dac2_cntl |= RADEON_DAC2_PALETTE_ACC_CTL;
189 WREG32(RADEON_DAC_CNTL2, dac2_cntl);
190
191 WREG8(RADEON_PALETTE_INDEX, 0);
192 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
193 WREG32(RADEON_PALETTE_30_DATA,
194 (radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] << 20) |
195 (radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] << 10) |
196 (radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] << 0));
197 }
198}
199
200void radeon_crtc_load_lut(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
201{
202 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
203 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
204
205 if (!crtc->enabled)
206 return;
207
208 if (ASIC_IS_DCE5(rdev))
209 dce5_crtc_load_lut(crtc);
210 else if (ASIC_IS_DCE4(rdev))
211 dce4_crtc_load_lut(crtc);
212 else if (ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev))
213 avivo_crtc_load_lut(crtc);
214 else
215 legacy_crtc_load_lut(crtc);
216}
217
218/** Sets the color ramps on behalf of fbcon */
219void radeon_crtc_fb_gamma_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 red, u16 green,
220 u16 blue, int regno)
221{
222 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
223
224 radeon_crtc->lut_r[regno] = red >> 6;
225 radeon_crtc->lut_g[regno] = green >> 6;
226 radeon_crtc->lut_b[regno] = blue >> 6;
227}
228
229/** Gets the color ramps on behalf of fbcon */
230void radeon_crtc_fb_gamma_get(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 *red, u16 *green,
231 u16 *blue, int regno)
232{
233 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
234
235 *red = radeon_crtc->lut_r[regno] << 6;
236 *green = radeon_crtc->lut_g[regno] << 6;
237 *blue = radeon_crtc->lut_b[regno] << 6;
238}
239
240static void radeon_crtc_gamma_set(struct drm_crtc *crtc, u16 *red, u16 *green,
241 u16 *blue, uint32_t start, uint32_t size)
242{
243 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
244 int end = (start + size > 256) ? 256 : start + size, i;
245
246 /* userspace palettes are always correct as is */
247 for (i = start; i < end; i++) {
248 radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] = red[i] >> 6;
249 radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] = green[i] >> 6;
250 radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] = blue[i] >> 6;
251 }
252 radeon_crtc_load_lut(crtc);
253}
254
255static void radeon_crtc_destroy(struct drm_crtc *crtc)
256{
257 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
258
259 drm_crtc_cleanup(crtc);
260 destroy_workqueue(radeon_crtc->flip_queue);
261 kfree(radeon_crtc);
262}
263
264/**
265 * radeon_unpin_work_func - unpin old buffer object
266 *
267 * @__work - kernel work item
268 *
269 * Unpin the old frame buffer object outside of the interrupt handler
270 */
271static void radeon_unpin_work_func(struct work_struct *__work)
272{
273 struct radeon_flip_work *work =
274 container_of(__work, struct radeon_flip_work, unpin_work);
275 int r;
276
277 /* unpin of the old buffer */
278 r = radeon_bo_reserve(work->old_rbo, false);
279 if (likely(r == 0)) {
280 r = radeon_bo_unpin(work->old_rbo);
281 if (unlikely(r != 0)) {
282 DRM_ERROR("failed to unpin buffer after flip\n");
283 }
284 radeon_bo_unreserve(work->old_rbo);
285 } else
286 DRM_ERROR("failed to reserve buffer after flip\n");
287
288 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(&work->old_rbo->gem_base);
289 kfree(work);
290}
291
292void radeon_crtc_handle_vblank(struct radeon_device *rdev, int crtc_id)
293{
294 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = rdev->mode_info.crtcs[crtc_id];
295 unsigned long flags;
296 u32 update_pending;
297 int vpos, hpos;
298
299 /* can happen during initialization */
300 if (radeon_crtc == NULL)
301 return;
302
303 /* Skip the pageflip completion check below (based on polling) on
304 * asics which reliably support hw pageflip completion irqs. pflip
305 * irqs are a reliable and race-free method of handling pageflip
306 * completion detection. A use_pflipirq module parameter < 2 allows
307 * to override this in case of asics with faulty pflip irqs.
308 * A module parameter of 0 would only use this polling based path,
309 * a parameter of 1 would use pflip irq only as a backup to this
310 * path, as in Linux 3.16.
311 */
312 if ((radeon_use_pflipirq == 2) && ASIC_IS_DCE4(rdev))
313 return;
314
315 spin_lock_irqsave(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
316 if (radeon_crtc->flip_status != RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED) {
317 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("radeon_crtc->flip_status = %d != "
318 "RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED(%d)\n",
319 radeon_crtc->flip_status,
320 RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED);
321 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
322 return;
323 }
324
325 update_pending = radeon_page_flip_pending(rdev, crtc_id);
326
327 /* Has the pageflip already completed in crtc, or is it certain
328 * to complete in this vblank?
329 */
330 if (update_pending &&
331 (DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID & radeon_get_crtc_scanoutpos(rdev->ddev,
332 crtc_id,
333 USE_REAL_VBLANKSTART,
334 &vpos, &hpos, NULL, NULL,
335 &rdev->mode_info.crtcs[crtc_id]->base.hwmode)) &&
336 ((vpos >= (99 * rdev->mode_info.crtcs[crtc_id]->base.hwmode.crtc_vdisplay)/100) ||
337 (vpos < 0 && !ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev)))) {
338 /* crtc didn't flip in this target vblank interval,
339 * but flip is pending in crtc. Based on the current
340 * scanout position we know that the current frame is
341 * (nearly) complete and the flip will (likely)
342 * complete before the start of the next frame.
343 */
344 update_pending = 0;
345 }
346 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
347 if (!update_pending)
348 radeon_crtc_handle_flip(rdev, crtc_id);
349}
350
351/**
352 * radeon_crtc_handle_flip - page flip completed
353 *
354 * @rdev: radeon device pointer
355 * @crtc_id: crtc number this event is for
356 *
357 * Called when we are sure that a page flip for this crtc is completed.
358 */
359void radeon_crtc_handle_flip(struct radeon_device *rdev, int crtc_id)
360{
361 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = rdev->mode_info.crtcs[crtc_id];
362 struct radeon_flip_work *work;
363 unsigned long flags;
364
365 /* this can happen at init */
366 if (radeon_crtc == NULL)
367 return;
368
369 spin_lock_irqsave(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
370 work = radeon_crtc->flip_work;
371 if (radeon_crtc->flip_status != RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED) {
372 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("radeon_crtc->flip_status = %d != "
373 "RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED(%d)\n",
374 radeon_crtc->flip_status,
375 RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED);
376 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
377 return;
378 }
379
380 /* Pageflip completed. Clean up. */
381 radeon_crtc->flip_status = RADEON_FLIP_NONE;
382 radeon_crtc->flip_work = NULL;
383
384 /* wakeup userspace */
385 if (work->event)
386 drm_send_vblank_event(rdev->ddev, crtc_id, work->event);
387
388 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&rdev->ddev->event_lock, flags);
389
390 drm_vblank_put(rdev->ddev, radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
391 radeon_irq_kms_pflip_irq_put(rdev, work->crtc_id);
392 queue_work(radeon_crtc->flip_queue, &work->unpin_work);
393}
394
395/**
396 * radeon_flip_work_func - page flip framebuffer
397 *
398 * @work - kernel work item
399 *
400 * Wait for the buffer object to become idle and do the actual page flip
401 */
402static void radeon_flip_work_func(struct work_struct *__work)
403{
404 struct radeon_flip_work *work =
405 container_of(__work, struct radeon_flip_work, flip_work);
406 struct radeon_device *rdev = work->rdev;
407 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = rdev->mode_info.crtcs[work->crtc_id];
408
409 struct drm_crtc *crtc = &radeon_crtc->base;
410 unsigned long flags;
411 int r;
412 int vpos, hpos, stat, min_udelay = 0;
413 unsigned repcnt = 4;
414 struct drm_vblank_crtc *vblank = &crtc->dev->vblank[work->crtc_id];
415
416 down_read(&rdev->exclusive_lock);
417 if (work->fence) {
418 struct radeon_fence *fence;
419
420 fence = to_radeon_fence(work->fence);
421 if (fence && fence->rdev == rdev) {
422 r = radeon_fence_wait(fence, false);
423 if (r == -EDEADLK) {
424 up_read(&rdev->exclusive_lock);
425 do {
426 r = radeon_gpu_reset(rdev);
427 } while (r == -EAGAIN);
428 down_read(&rdev->exclusive_lock);
429 }
430 } else
431 r = fence_wait(work->fence, false);
432
433 if (r)
434 DRM_ERROR("failed to wait on page flip fence (%d)!\n", r);
435
436 /* We continue with the page flip even if we failed to wait on
437 * the fence, otherwise the DRM core and userspace will be
438 * confused about which BO the CRTC is scanning out
439 */
440
441 fence_put(work->fence);
442 work->fence = NULL;
443 }
444
445 /* We borrow the event spin lock for protecting flip_status */
446 spin_lock_irqsave(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
447
448 /* set the proper interrupt */
449 radeon_irq_kms_pflip_irq_get(rdev, radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
450
451 /* If this happens to execute within the "virtually extended" vblank
452 * interval before the start of the real vblank interval then it needs
453 * to delay programming the mmio flip until the real vblank is entered.
454 * This prevents completing a flip too early due to the way we fudge
455 * our vblank counter and vblank timestamps in order to work around the
456 * problem that the hw fires vblank interrupts before actual start of
457 * vblank (when line buffer refilling is done for a frame). It
458 * complements the fudging logic in radeon_get_crtc_scanoutpos() for
459 * timestamping and radeon_get_vblank_counter_kms() for vblank counts.
460 *
461 * In practice this won't execute very often unless on very fast
462 * machines because the time window for this to happen is very small.
463 */
464 while (radeon_crtc->enabled && --repcnt) {
465 /* GET_DISTANCE_TO_VBLANKSTART returns distance to real vblank
466 * start in hpos, and to the "fudged earlier" vblank start in
467 * vpos.
468 */
469 stat = radeon_get_crtc_scanoutpos(rdev->ddev, work->crtc_id,
470 GET_DISTANCE_TO_VBLANKSTART,
471 &vpos, &hpos, NULL, NULL,
472 &crtc->hwmode);
473
474 if ((stat & (DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID | DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE)) !=
475 (DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID | DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE) ||
476 !(vpos >= 0 && hpos <= 0))
477 break;
478
479 /* Sleep at least until estimated real start of hw vblank */
480 min_udelay = (-hpos + 1) * max(vblank->linedur_ns / 1000, 5);
481 if (min_udelay > vblank->framedur_ns / 2000) {
482 /* Don't wait ridiculously long - something is wrong */
483 repcnt = 0;
484 break;
485 }
486 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
487 usleep_range(min_udelay, 2 * min_udelay);
488 spin_lock_irqsave(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
489 };
490
491 if (!repcnt)
492 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Delay problem on crtc %d: min_udelay %d, "
493 "framedur %d, linedur %d, stat %d, vpos %d, "
494 "hpos %d\n", work->crtc_id, min_udelay,
495 vblank->framedur_ns / 1000,
496 vblank->linedur_ns / 1000, stat, vpos, hpos);
497
498 /* do the flip (mmio) */
499 radeon_page_flip(rdev, radeon_crtc->crtc_id, work->base);
500
501 radeon_crtc->flip_status = RADEON_FLIP_SUBMITTED;
502 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
503 up_read(&rdev->exclusive_lock);
504}
505
506static int radeon_crtc_page_flip(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
507 struct drm_framebuffer *fb,
508 struct drm_pending_vblank_event *event,
509 uint32_t page_flip_flags)
510{
511 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
512 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
513 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
514 struct radeon_framebuffer *old_radeon_fb;
515 struct radeon_framebuffer *new_radeon_fb;
516 struct drm_gem_object *obj;
517 struct radeon_flip_work *work;
518 struct radeon_bo *new_rbo;
519 uint32_t tiling_flags, pitch_pixels;
520 uint64_t base;
521 unsigned long flags;
522 int r;
523
524 work = kzalloc(sizeof *work, GFP_KERNEL);
525 if (work == NULL)
526 return -ENOMEM;
527
528 INIT_WORK(&work->flip_work, radeon_flip_work_func);
529 INIT_WORK(&work->unpin_work, radeon_unpin_work_func);
530
531 work->rdev = rdev;
532 work->crtc_id = radeon_crtc->crtc_id;
533 work->event = event;
534
535 /* schedule unpin of the old buffer */
536 old_radeon_fb = to_radeon_framebuffer(crtc->primary->fb);
537 obj = old_radeon_fb->obj;
538
539 /* take a reference to the old object */
540 drm_gem_object_reference(obj);
541 work->old_rbo = gem_to_radeon_bo(obj);
542
543 new_radeon_fb = to_radeon_framebuffer(fb);
544 obj = new_radeon_fb->obj;
545 new_rbo = gem_to_radeon_bo(obj);
546
547 /* pin the new buffer */
548 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("flip-ioctl() cur_rbo = %p, new_rbo = %p\n",
549 work->old_rbo, new_rbo);
550
551 r = radeon_bo_reserve(new_rbo, false);
552 if (unlikely(r != 0)) {
553 DRM_ERROR("failed to reserve new rbo buffer before flip\n");
554 goto cleanup;
555 }
556 /* Only 27 bit offset for legacy CRTC */
557 r = radeon_bo_pin_restricted(new_rbo, RADEON_GEM_DOMAIN_VRAM,
558 ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev) ? 0 : 1 << 27, &base);
559 if (unlikely(r != 0)) {
560 radeon_bo_unreserve(new_rbo);
561 r = -EINVAL;
562 DRM_ERROR("failed to pin new rbo buffer before flip\n");
563 goto cleanup;
564 }
565 work->fence = fence_get(reservation_object_get_excl(new_rbo->tbo.resv));
566 radeon_bo_get_tiling_flags(new_rbo, &tiling_flags, NULL);
567 radeon_bo_unreserve(new_rbo);
568
569 if (!ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev)) {
570 /* crtc offset is from display base addr not FB location */
571 base -= radeon_crtc->legacy_display_base_addr;
572 pitch_pixels = fb->pitches[0] / (fb->bits_per_pixel / 8);
573
574 if (tiling_flags & RADEON_TILING_MACRO) {
575 if (ASIC_IS_R300(rdev)) {
576 base &= ~0x7ff;
577 } else {
578 int byteshift = fb->bits_per_pixel >> 4;
579 int tile_addr = (((crtc->y >> 3) * pitch_pixels + crtc->x) >> (8 - byteshift)) << 11;
580 base += tile_addr + ((crtc->x << byteshift) % 256) + ((crtc->y % 8) << 8);
581 }
582 } else {
583 int offset = crtc->y * pitch_pixels + crtc->x;
584 switch (fb->bits_per_pixel) {
585 case 8:
586 default:
587 offset *= 1;
588 break;
589 case 15:
590 case 16:
591 offset *= 2;
592 break;
593 case 24:
594 offset *= 3;
595 break;
596 case 32:
597 offset *= 4;
598 break;
599 }
600 base += offset;
601 }
602 base &= ~7;
603 }
604 work->base = base;
605
606 r = drm_vblank_get(crtc->dev, radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
607 if (r) {
608 DRM_ERROR("failed to get vblank before flip\n");
609 goto pflip_cleanup;
610 }
611
612 /* We borrow the event spin lock for protecting flip_work */
613 spin_lock_irqsave(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
614
615 if (radeon_crtc->flip_status != RADEON_FLIP_NONE) {
616 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("flip queue: crtc already busy\n");
617 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
618 r = -EBUSY;
619 goto vblank_cleanup;
620 }
621 radeon_crtc->flip_status = RADEON_FLIP_PENDING;
622 radeon_crtc->flip_work = work;
623
624 /* update crtc fb */
625 crtc->primary->fb = fb;
626
627 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&crtc->dev->event_lock, flags);
628
629 queue_work(radeon_crtc->flip_queue, &work->flip_work);
630 return 0;
631
632vblank_cleanup:
633 drm_vblank_put(crtc->dev, radeon_crtc->crtc_id);
634
635pflip_cleanup:
636 if (unlikely(radeon_bo_reserve(new_rbo, false) != 0)) {
637 DRM_ERROR("failed to reserve new rbo in error path\n");
638 goto cleanup;
639 }
640 if (unlikely(radeon_bo_unpin(new_rbo) != 0)) {
641 DRM_ERROR("failed to unpin new rbo in error path\n");
642 }
643 radeon_bo_unreserve(new_rbo);
644
645cleanup:
646 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(&work->old_rbo->gem_base);
647 fence_put(work->fence);
648 kfree(work);
649 return r;
650}
651
652static int
653radeon_crtc_set_config(struct drm_mode_set *set)
654{
655 struct drm_device *dev;
656 struct radeon_device *rdev;
657 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
658 bool active = false;
659 int ret;
660
661 if (!set || !set->crtc)
662 return -EINVAL;
663
664 dev = set->crtc->dev;
665
666 ret = pm_runtime_get_sync(dev->dev);
667 if (ret < 0)
668 return ret;
669
670 ret = drm_crtc_helper_set_config(set);
671
672 list_for_each_entry(crtc, &dev->mode_config.crtc_list, head)
673 if (crtc->enabled)
674 active = true;
675
676 pm_runtime_mark_last_busy(dev->dev);
677
678 rdev = dev->dev_private;
679 /* if we have active crtcs and we don't have a power ref,
680 take the current one */
681 if (active && !rdev->have_disp_power_ref) {
682 rdev->have_disp_power_ref = true;
683 return ret;
684 }
685 /* if we have no active crtcs, then drop the power ref
686 we got before */
687 if (!active && rdev->have_disp_power_ref) {
688 pm_runtime_put_autosuspend(dev->dev);
689 rdev->have_disp_power_ref = false;
690 }
691
692 /* drop the power reference we got coming in here */
693 pm_runtime_put_autosuspend(dev->dev);
694 return ret;
695}
696static const struct drm_crtc_funcs radeon_crtc_funcs = {
697 .cursor_set2 = radeon_crtc_cursor_set2,
698 .cursor_move = radeon_crtc_cursor_move,
699 .gamma_set = radeon_crtc_gamma_set,
700 .set_config = radeon_crtc_set_config,
701 .destroy = radeon_crtc_destroy,
702 .page_flip = radeon_crtc_page_flip,
703};
704
705static void radeon_crtc_init(struct drm_device *dev, int index)
706{
707 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
708 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc;
709 int i;
710
711 radeon_crtc = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_crtc) + (RADEONFB_CONN_LIMIT * sizeof(struct drm_connector *)), GFP_KERNEL);
712 if (radeon_crtc == NULL)
713 return;
714
715 drm_crtc_init(dev, &radeon_crtc->base, &radeon_crtc_funcs);
716
717 drm_mode_crtc_set_gamma_size(&radeon_crtc->base, 256);
718 radeon_crtc->crtc_id = index;
719 radeon_crtc->flip_queue = create_singlethread_workqueue("radeon-crtc");
720 rdev->mode_info.crtcs[index] = radeon_crtc;
721
722 if (rdev->family >= CHIP_BONAIRE) {
723 radeon_crtc->max_cursor_width = CIK_CURSOR_WIDTH;
724 radeon_crtc->max_cursor_height = CIK_CURSOR_HEIGHT;
725 } else {
726 radeon_crtc->max_cursor_width = CURSOR_WIDTH;
727 radeon_crtc->max_cursor_height = CURSOR_HEIGHT;
728 }
729 dev->mode_config.cursor_width = radeon_crtc->max_cursor_width;
730 dev->mode_config.cursor_height = radeon_crtc->max_cursor_height;
731
732#if 0
733 radeon_crtc->mode_set.crtc = &radeon_crtc->base;
734 radeon_crtc->mode_set.connectors = (struct drm_connector **)(radeon_crtc + 1);
735 radeon_crtc->mode_set.num_connectors = 0;
736#endif
737
738 for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
739 radeon_crtc->lut_r[i] = i << 2;
740 radeon_crtc->lut_g[i] = i << 2;
741 radeon_crtc->lut_b[i] = i << 2;
742 }
743
744 if (rdev->is_atom_bios && (ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev) || radeon_r4xx_atom))
745 radeon_atombios_init_crtc(dev, radeon_crtc);
746 else
747 radeon_legacy_init_crtc(dev, radeon_crtc);
748}

800static void radeon_print_display_setup(struct drm_device *dev)
801{
802 struct drm_connector *connector;
803 struct radeon_connector *radeon_connector;
804 struct drm_encoder *encoder;
805 struct radeon_encoder *radeon_encoder;
806 uint32_t devices;
807 int i = 0;
808
809 DRM_INFO("Radeon Display Connectors\n");
810 list_for_each_entry(connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, head) {
811 radeon_connector = to_radeon_connector(connector);
812 DRM_INFO("Connector %d:\n", i);
813 DRM_INFO(" %s\n", connector->name);
814 if (radeon_connector->hpd.hpd != RADEON_HPD_NONE)
815 DRM_INFO(" %s\n", hpd_names[radeon_connector->hpd.hpd]);
816 if (radeon_connector->ddc_bus) {
817 DRM_INFO(" DDC: 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x 0x%x\n",
818 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.mask_clk_reg,
819 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.mask_data_reg,
820 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.a_clk_reg,
821 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.a_data_reg,
822 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.en_clk_reg,
823 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.en_data_reg,
824 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.y_clk_reg,
825 radeon_connector->ddc_bus->rec.y_data_reg);
826 if (radeon_connector->router.ddc_valid)
827 DRM_INFO(" DDC Router 0x%x/0x%x\n",
828 radeon_connector->router.ddc_mux_control_pin,
829 radeon_connector->router.ddc_mux_state);
830 if (radeon_connector->router.cd_valid)
831 DRM_INFO(" Clock/Data Router 0x%x/0x%x\n",
832 radeon_connector->router.cd_mux_control_pin,
833 radeon_connector->router.cd_mux_state);
834 } else {
835 if (connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_VGA ||
836 connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVII ||
837 connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVID ||
838 connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVIA ||
839 connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIA ||
840 connector->connector_type == DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIB)
841 DRM_INFO(" DDC: no ddc bus - possible BIOS bug - please report to xorg-driver-ati@lists.x.org\n");
842 }
843 DRM_INFO(" Encoders:\n");
844 list_for_each_entry(encoder, &dev->mode_config.encoder_list, head) {
845 radeon_encoder = to_radeon_encoder(encoder);
846 devices = radeon_encoder->devices & radeon_connector->devices;
847 if (devices) {
848 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_CRT1_SUPPORT)
849 DRM_INFO(" CRT1: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
850 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_CRT2_SUPPORT)
851 DRM_INFO(" CRT2: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
852 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_LCD1_SUPPORT)
853 DRM_INFO(" LCD1: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
854 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP1_SUPPORT)
855 DRM_INFO(" DFP1: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
856 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP2_SUPPORT)
857 DRM_INFO(" DFP2: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
858 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP3_SUPPORT)
859 DRM_INFO(" DFP3: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
860 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP4_SUPPORT)
861 DRM_INFO(" DFP4: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
862 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP5_SUPPORT)
863 DRM_INFO(" DFP5: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
864 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_DFP6_SUPPORT)
865 DRM_INFO(" DFP6: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
866 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_TV1_SUPPORT)
867 DRM_INFO(" TV1: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
868 if (devices & ATOM_DEVICE_CV_SUPPORT)
869 DRM_INFO(" CV: %s\n", encoder_names[radeon_encoder->encoder_id]);
870 }
871 }
872 i++;
873 }
874}
875
876static bool radeon_setup_enc_conn(struct drm_device *dev)
877{
878 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
879 bool ret = false;
880
881 if (rdev->bios) {
882 if (rdev->is_atom_bios) {
883 ret = radeon_get_atom_connector_info_from_supported_devices_table(dev);
884 if (ret == false)
885 ret = radeon_get_atom_connector_info_from_object_table(dev);
886 } else {
887 ret = radeon_get_legacy_connector_info_from_bios(dev);
888 if (ret == false)
889 ret = radeon_get_legacy_connector_info_from_table(dev);
890 }
891 } else {
892 if (!ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev))
893 ret = radeon_get_legacy_connector_info_from_table(dev);
894 }
895 if (ret) {
896 radeon_setup_encoder_clones(dev);
897 radeon_print_display_setup(dev);
898 }
899
900 return ret;
901}
902
903/* avivo */
904
905/**
906 * avivo_reduce_ratio - fractional number reduction
907 *
908 * @nom: nominator
909 * @den: denominator
910 * @nom_min: minimum value for nominator
911 * @den_min: minimum value for denominator
912 *
913 * Find the greatest common divisor and apply it on both nominator and
914 * denominator, but make nominator and denominator are at least as large
915 * as their minimum values.
916 */
917static void avivo_reduce_ratio(unsigned *nom, unsigned *den,
918 unsigned nom_min, unsigned den_min)
919{
920 unsigned tmp;
921
922 /* reduce the numbers to a simpler ratio */
923 tmp = gcd(*nom, *den);
924 *nom /= tmp;
925 *den /= tmp;
926
927 /* make sure nominator is large enough */
928 if (*nom < nom_min) {
929 tmp = DIV_ROUND_UP(nom_min, *nom);
930 *nom *= tmp;
931 *den *= tmp;
932 }
933
934 /* make sure the denominator is large enough */
935 if (*den < den_min) {
936 tmp = DIV_ROUND_UP(den_min, *den);
937 *nom *= tmp;
938 *den *= tmp;
939 }
940}
941
942/**
943 * avivo_get_fb_ref_div - feedback and ref divider calculation
944 *
945 * @nom: nominator
946 * @den: denominator
947 * @post_div: post divider
948 * @fb_div_max: feedback divider maximum
949 * @ref_div_max: reference divider maximum
950 * @fb_div: resulting feedback divider
951 * @ref_div: resulting reference divider
952 *
953 * Calculate feedback and reference divider for a given post divider. Makes
954 * sure we stay within the limits.
955 */
956static void avivo_get_fb_ref_div(unsigned nom, unsigned den, unsigned post_div,
957 unsigned fb_div_max, unsigned ref_div_max,
958 unsigned *fb_div, unsigned *ref_div)
959{
960 /* limit reference * post divider to a maximum */
961 ref_div_max = max(min(100 / post_div, ref_div_max), 1u);
962
963 /* get matching reference and feedback divider */
964 *ref_div = min(max(DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST(den, post_div), 1u), ref_div_max);
965 *fb_div = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST(nom * *ref_div * post_div, den);
966
967 /* limit fb divider to its maximum */
968 if (*fb_div > fb_div_max) {
969 *ref_div = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST(*ref_div * fb_div_max, *fb_div);
970 *fb_div = fb_div_max;
971 }
972}
973
974/**
975 * radeon_compute_pll_avivo - compute PLL paramaters
976 *
977 * @pll: information about the PLL
978 * @dot_clock_p: resulting pixel clock
979 * fb_div_p: resulting feedback divider
980 * frac_fb_div_p: fractional part of the feedback divider
981 * ref_div_p: resulting reference divider
982 * post_div_p: resulting reference divider
983 *
984 * Try to calculate the PLL parameters to generate the given frequency:
985 * dot_clock = (ref_freq * feedback_div) / (ref_div * post_div)
986 */
987void radeon_compute_pll_avivo(struct radeon_pll *pll,
988 u32 freq,
989 u32 *dot_clock_p,
990 u32 *fb_div_p,
991 u32 *frac_fb_div_p,
992 u32 *ref_div_p,
993 u32 *post_div_p)
994{
995 unsigned target_clock = pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV ?
996 freq : freq / 10;
997
998 unsigned fb_div_min, fb_div_max, fb_div;
999 unsigned post_div_min, post_div_max, post_div;
1000 unsigned ref_div_min, ref_div_max, ref_div;
1001 unsigned post_div_best, diff_best;
1002 unsigned nom, den;
1003
1004 /* determine allowed feedback divider range */
1005 fb_div_min = pll->min_feedback_div;
1006 fb_div_max = pll->max_feedback_div;
1007
1008 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV) {
1009 fb_div_min *= 10;
1010 fb_div_max *= 10;
1011 }
1012
1013 /* determine allowed ref divider range */
1014 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_REF_DIV)
1015 ref_div_min = pll->reference_div;
1016 else
1017 ref_div_min = pll->min_ref_div;
1018
1019 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV &&
1020 pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_REF_DIV)
1021 ref_div_max = pll->reference_div;
1022 else if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_MINM_OVER_MAXP)
1023 /* fix for problems on RS880 */
1024 ref_div_max = min(pll->max_ref_div, 7u);
1025 else
1026 ref_div_max = pll->max_ref_div;
1027
1028 /* determine allowed post divider range */
1029 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_POST_DIV) {
1030 post_div_min = pll->post_div;
1031 post_div_max = pll->post_div;
1032 } else {
1033 unsigned vco_min, vco_max;
1034
1035 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_IS_LCD) {
1036 vco_min = pll->lcd_pll_out_min;
1037 vco_max = pll->lcd_pll_out_max;
1038 } else {
1039 vco_min = pll->pll_out_min;
1040 vco_max = pll->pll_out_max;
1041 }
1042
1043 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV) {
1044 vco_min *= 10;
1045 vco_max *= 10;
1046 }
1047
1048 post_div_min = vco_min / target_clock;
1049 if ((target_clock * post_div_min) < vco_min)
1050 ++post_div_min;
1051 if (post_div_min < pll->min_post_div)
1052 post_div_min = pll->min_post_div;
1053
1054 post_div_max = vco_max / target_clock;
1055 if ((target_clock * post_div_max) > vco_max)
1056 --post_div_max;
1057 if (post_div_max > pll->max_post_div)
1058 post_div_max = pll->max_post_div;
1059 }
1060
1061 /* represent the searched ratio as fractional number */
1062 nom = target_clock;
1063 den = pll->reference_freq;
1064
1065 /* reduce the numbers to a simpler ratio */
1066 avivo_reduce_ratio(&nom, &den, fb_div_min, post_div_min);
1067
1068 /* now search for a post divider */
1069 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_MINM_OVER_MAXP)
1070 post_div_best = post_div_min;
1071 else
1072 post_div_best = post_div_max;
1073 diff_best = ~0;
1074
1075 for (post_div = post_div_min; post_div <= post_div_max; ++post_div) {
1076 unsigned diff;
1077 avivo_get_fb_ref_div(nom, den, post_div, fb_div_max,
1078 ref_div_max, &fb_div, &ref_div);
1079 diff = abs(target_clock - (pll->reference_freq * fb_div) /
1080 (ref_div * post_div));
1081
1082 if (diff < diff_best || (diff == diff_best &&
1083 !(pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_MINM_OVER_MAXP))) {
1084
1085 post_div_best = post_div;
1086 diff_best = diff;
1087 }
1088 }
1089 post_div = post_div_best;
1090
1091 /* get the feedback and reference divider for the optimal value */
1092 avivo_get_fb_ref_div(nom, den, post_div, fb_div_max, ref_div_max,
1093 &fb_div, &ref_div);
1094
1095 /* reduce the numbers to a simpler ratio once more */
1096 /* this also makes sure that the reference divider is large enough */
1097 avivo_reduce_ratio(&fb_div, &ref_div, fb_div_min, ref_div_min);
1098
1099 /* avoid high jitter with small fractional dividers */
1100 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV && (fb_div % 10)) {
1101 fb_div_min = max(fb_div_min, (9 - (fb_div % 10)) * 20 + 50);
1102 if (fb_div < fb_div_min) {
1103 unsigned tmp = DIV_ROUND_UP(fb_div_min, fb_div);
1104 fb_div *= tmp;
1105 ref_div *= tmp;
1106 }
1107 }
1108
1109 /* and finally save the result */
1110 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV) {
1111 *fb_div_p = fb_div / 10;
1112 *frac_fb_div_p = fb_div % 10;
1113 } else {
1114 *fb_div_p = fb_div;
1115 *frac_fb_div_p = 0;
1116 }
1117
1118 *dot_clock_p = ((pll->reference_freq * *fb_div_p * 10) +
1119 (pll->reference_freq * *frac_fb_div_p)) /
1120 (ref_div * post_div * 10);
1121 *ref_div_p = ref_div;
1122 *post_div_p = post_div;
1123
1124 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%d - %d, pll dividers - fb: %d.%d ref: %d, post %d\n",
1125 freq, *dot_clock_p * 10, *fb_div_p, *frac_fb_div_p,
1126 ref_div, post_div);
1127}
1128
1129/* pre-avivo */
1130static inline uint32_t radeon_div(uint64_t n, uint32_t d)
1131{
1132 uint64_t mod __unused;
1133
1134 n += d / 2;
1135
1136 mod = do_div(n, d);
1137 return n;
1138}
1139
1140void radeon_compute_pll_legacy(struct radeon_pll *pll,
1141 uint64_t freq,
1142 uint32_t *dot_clock_p,
1143 uint32_t *fb_div_p,
1144 uint32_t *frac_fb_div_p,
1145 uint32_t *ref_div_p,
1146 uint32_t *post_div_p)
1147{
1148 uint32_t min_ref_div = pll->min_ref_div;
1149 uint32_t max_ref_div = pll->max_ref_div;
1150 uint32_t min_post_div = pll->min_post_div;
1151 uint32_t max_post_div = pll->max_post_div;
1152 uint32_t min_fractional_feed_div = 0;
1153 uint32_t max_fractional_feed_div = 0;
1154 uint32_t best_vco = pll->best_vco;
1155 uint32_t best_post_div = 1;
1156 uint32_t best_ref_div = 1;
1157 uint32_t best_feedback_div = 1;
1158 uint32_t best_frac_feedback_div = 0;
1159 uint32_t best_freq = -1;
1160 uint32_t best_error = 0xffffffff;
1161 uint32_t best_vco_diff = 1;
1162 uint32_t post_div;
1163 u32 pll_out_min, pll_out_max;
1164
1165 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PLL freq %"PRIu64" %u %u\n", freq, pll->min_ref_div, pll->max_ref_div);
1166 freq = freq * 1000;
1167
1168 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_IS_LCD) {
1169 pll_out_min = pll->lcd_pll_out_min;
1170 pll_out_max = pll->lcd_pll_out_max;
1171 } else {
1172 pll_out_min = pll->pll_out_min;
1173 pll_out_max = pll->pll_out_max;
1174 }
1175
1176 if (pll_out_min > 64800)
1177 pll_out_min = 64800;
1178
1179 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_REF_DIV)
1180 min_ref_div = max_ref_div = pll->reference_div;
1181 else {
1182 while (min_ref_div < max_ref_div-1) {
1183 uint32_t mid = (min_ref_div + max_ref_div) / 2;
1184 uint32_t pll_in = pll->reference_freq / mid;
1185 if (pll_in < pll->pll_in_min)
1186 max_ref_div = mid;
1187 else if (pll_in > pll->pll_in_max)
1188 min_ref_div = mid;
1189 else
1190 break;
1191 }
1192 }
1193
1194 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_POST_DIV)
1195 min_post_div = max_post_div = pll->post_div;
1196
1197 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_USE_FRAC_FB_DIV) {
1198 min_fractional_feed_div = pll->min_frac_feedback_div;
1199 max_fractional_feed_div = pll->max_frac_feedback_div;
1200 }
1201
1202 for (post_div = max_post_div; post_div >= min_post_div; --post_div) {
1203 uint32_t ref_div;
1204
1205 if ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_NO_ODD_POST_DIV) && (post_div & 1))
1206 continue;
1207
1208 /* legacy radeons only have a few post_divs */
1209 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_LEGACY) {
1210 if ((post_div == 5) ||
1211 (post_div == 7) ||
1212 (post_div == 9) ||
1213 (post_div == 10) ||
1214 (post_div == 11) ||
1215 (post_div == 13) ||
1216 (post_div == 14) ||
1217 (post_div == 15))
1218 continue;
1219 }
1220
1221 for (ref_div = min_ref_div; ref_div <= max_ref_div; ++ref_div) {
1222 uint32_t feedback_div, current_freq = 0, error, vco_diff;
1223 uint32_t pll_in = pll->reference_freq / ref_div;
1224 uint32_t min_feed_div = pll->min_feedback_div;
1225 uint32_t max_feed_div = pll->max_feedback_div + 1;
1226
1227 if (pll_in < pll->pll_in_min || pll_in > pll->pll_in_max)
1228 continue;
1229
1230 while (min_feed_div < max_feed_div) {
1231 uint32_t vco;
1232 uint32_t min_frac_feed_div = min_fractional_feed_div;
1233 uint32_t max_frac_feed_div = max_fractional_feed_div + 1;
1234 uint32_t frac_feedback_div;
1235 uint64_t tmp;
1236
1237 feedback_div = (min_feed_div + max_feed_div) / 2;
1238
1239 tmp = (uint64_t)pll->reference_freq * feedback_div;
1240 vco = radeon_div(tmp, ref_div);
1241
1242 if (vco < pll_out_min) {
1243 min_feed_div = feedback_div + 1;
1244 continue;
1245 } else if (vco > pll_out_max) {
1246 max_feed_div = feedback_div;
1247 continue;
1248 }
1249
1250 while (min_frac_feed_div < max_frac_feed_div) {
1251 frac_feedback_div = (min_frac_feed_div + max_frac_feed_div) / 2;
1252 tmp = (uint64_t)pll->reference_freq * 10000 * feedback_div;
1253 tmp += (uint64_t)pll->reference_freq * 1000 * frac_feedback_div;
1254 current_freq = radeon_div(tmp, ref_div * post_div);
1255
1256 if (pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_CLOSEST_LOWER) {
1257 if (freq < current_freq)
1258 error = 0xffffffff;
1259 else
1260 error = freq - current_freq;
1261 } else
1262 error = abs(current_freq - freq);
1263 vco_diff = abs(vco - best_vco);
1264
1265 if ((best_vco == 0 && error < best_error) ||
1266 (best_vco != 0 &&
1267 ((best_error > 100 && error < best_error - 100) ||
1268 (abs(error - best_error) < 100 && vco_diff < best_vco_diff)))) {
1269 best_post_div = post_div;
1270 best_ref_div = ref_div;
1271 best_feedback_div = feedback_div;
1272 best_frac_feedback_div = frac_feedback_div;
1273 best_freq = current_freq;
1274 best_error = error;
1275 best_vco_diff = vco_diff;
1276 } else if (current_freq == freq) {
1277 if (best_freq == -1) {
1278 best_post_div = post_div;
1279 best_ref_div = ref_div;
1280 best_feedback_div = feedback_div;
1281 best_frac_feedback_div = frac_feedback_div;
1282 best_freq = current_freq;
1283 best_error = error;
1284 best_vco_diff = vco_diff;
1285 } else if (((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_LOW_REF_DIV) && (ref_div < best_ref_div)) ||
1286 ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_HIGH_REF_DIV) && (ref_div > best_ref_div)) ||
1287 ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_LOW_FB_DIV) && (feedback_div < best_feedback_div)) ||
1288 ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_HIGH_FB_DIV) && (feedback_div > best_feedback_div)) ||
1289 ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_LOW_POST_DIV) && (post_div < best_post_div)) ||
1290 ((pll->flags & RADEON_PLL_PREFER_HIGH_POST_DIV) && (post_div > best_post_div))) {
1291 best_post_div = post_div;
1292 best_ref_div = ref_div;
1293 best_feedback_div = feedback_div;
1294 best_frac_feedback_div = frac_feedback_div;
1295 best_freq = current_freq;
1296 best_error = error;
1297 best_vco_diff = vco_diff;
1298 }
1299 }
1300 if (current_freq < freq)
1301 min_frac_feed_div = frac_feedback_div + 1;
1302 else
1303 max_frac_feed_div = frac_feedback_div;
1304 }
1305 if (current_freq < freq)
1306 min_feed_div = feedback_div + 1;
1307 else
1308 max_feed_div = feedback_div;
1309 }
1310 }
1311 }
1312
1313 *dot_clock_p = best_freq / 10000;
1314 *fb_div_p = best_feedback_div;
1315 *frac_fb_div_p = best_frac_feedback_div;
1316 *ref_div_p = best_ref_div;
1317 *post_div_p = best_post_div;
1318 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%lld %d, pll dividers - fb: %d.%d ref: %d, post %d\n",
1319 (long long)freq,
1320 best_freq / 1000, best_feedback_div, best_frac_feedback_div,
1321 best_ref_div, best_post_div);
1322
1323}
1324
1325static void radeon_user_framebuffer_destroy(struct drm_framebuffer *fb)
1326{
1327 struct radeon_framebuffer *radeon_fb = to_radeon_framebuffer(fb);
1328
1329 if (radeon_fb->obj) {
1330 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(radeon_fb->obj);
1331 }
1332 drm_framebuffer_cleanup(fb);
1333 kfree(radeon_fb);
1334}
1335
1336static int radeon_user_framebuffer_create_handle(struct drm_framebuffer *fb,
1337 struct drm_file *file_priv,
1338 unsigned int *handle)
1339{
1340 struct radeon_framebuffer *radeon_fb = to_radeon_framebuffer(fb);
1341
1342 return drm_gem_handle_create(file_priv, radeon_fb->obj, handle);
1343}
1344
1345static const struct drm_framebuffer_funcs radeon_fb_funcs = {
1346 .destroy = radeon_user_framebuffer_destroy,
1347 .create_handle = radeon_user_framebuffer_create_handle,
1348};
1349
1350int
1351radeon_framebuffer_init(struct drm_device *dev,
1352 struct radeon_framebuffer *rfb,
1353 struct drm_mode_fb_cmd2 *mode_cmd,
1354 struct drm_gem_object *obj)
1355{
1356 int ret;
1357 rfb->obj = obj;
1358 drm_helper_mode_fill_fb_struct(&rfb->base, mode_cmd);
1359 ret = drm_framebuffer_init(dev, &rfb->base, &radeon_fb_funcs);
1360 if (ret) {
1361 rfb->obj = NULL;
1362 return ret;
1363 }
1364 return 0;
1365}
1366
1367static struct drm_framebuffer *
1368radeon_user_framebuffer_create(struct drm_device *dev,
1369 struct drm_file *file_priv,
1370 struct drm_mode_fb_cmd2 *mode_cmd)
1371{
1372 struct drm_gem_object *obj;
1373 struct radeon_framebuffer *radeon_fb;
1374 int ret;
1375
1376 obj = drm_gem_object_lookup(dev, file_priv, mode_cmd->handles[0]);
1377 if (obj == NULL) {
1378 dev_err(dev->dev, "No GEM object associated to handle 0x%08X, "
1379 "can't create framebuffer\n", mode_cmd->handles[0]);
1380 return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
1381 }
1382
1383 /* Handle is imported dma-buf, so cannot be migrated to VRAM for scanout */
1384 if (obj->import_attach) {
1385 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Cannot create framebuffer from imported dma_buf\n");
1386 return ERR_PTR(-EINVAL);
1387 }
1388
1389 radeon_fb = kzalloc(sizeof(*radeon_fb), GFP_KERNEL);
1390 if (radeon_fb == NULL) {
1391 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(obj);
1392 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
1393 }
1394
1395 ret = radeon_framebuffer_init(dev, radeon_fb, mode_cmd, obj);
1396 if (ret) {
1397 kfree(radeon_fb);
1398 drm_gem_object_unreference_unlocked(obj);
1399 return ERR_PTR(ret);
1400 }
1401
1402 return &radeon_fb->base;
1403}
1404
1405static void radeon_output_poll_changed(struct drm_device *dev)
1406{
1407 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
1408 radeon_fb_output_poll_changed(rdev);
1409}
1410
1411static const struct drm_mode_config_funcs radeon_mode_funcs = {
1412 .fb_create = radeon_user_framebuffer_create,
1413 .output_poll_changed = radeon_output_poll_changed
1414};

1417{ { 0, "driver" },
1418 { 1, "bios" },
1419};

1422{ { TV_STD_NTSC, "ntsc" },
1423 { TV_STD_PAL, "pal" },
1424 { TV_STD_PAL_M, "pal-m" },
1425 { TV_STD_PAL_60, "pal-60" },
1426 { TV_STD_NTSC_J, "ntsc-j" },
1427 { TV_STD_SCART_PAL, "scart-pal" },
1428 { TV_STD_PAL_CN, "pal-cn" },
1429 { TV_STD_SECAM, "secam" },
1430};
1431

1433{ { UNDERSCAN_OFF, "off" },
1434 { UNDERSCAN_ON, "on" },
1435 { UNDERSCAN_AUTO, "auto" },
1436};

1439{ { RADEON_AUDIO_DISABLE, "off" },
1440 { RADEON_AUDIO_ENABLE, "on" },
1441 { RADEON_AUDIO_AUTO, "auto" },
1442};

1445static struct drm_prop_enum_list radeon_dither_enum_list[] =
1446{ { RADEON_FMT_DITHER_DISABLE, "off" },
1447 { RADEON_FMT_DITHER_ENABLE, "on" },

1453 { RADEON_OUTPUT_CSC_YCBCR601, "ycbcr601" },
1454 { RADEON_OUTPUT_CSC_YCBCR709, "ycbcr709" },
1455};
1456
1457static int radeon_modeset_create_props(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1458{
1459 int sz;
1460
1461 if (rdev->is_atom_bios) {
1462 rdev->mode_info.coherent_mode_property =
1463 drm_property_create_range(rdev->ddev, 0 , "coherent", 0, 1);
1464 if (!rdev->mode_info.coherent_mode_property)
1465 return -ENOMEM;
1466 }
1467
1468 if (!ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev)) {
1469 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_tmds_pll_enum_list);
1470 rdev->mode_info.tmds_pll_property =
1471 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1472 "tmds_pll",
1473 radeon_tmds_pll_enum_list, sz);
1474 }
1475
1476 rdev->mode_info.load_detect_property =
1477 drm_property_create_range(rdev->ddev, 0, "load detection", 0, 1);
1478 if (!rdev->mode_info.load_detect_property)
1479 return -ENOMEM;
1480
1481 drm_mode_create_scaling_mode_property(rdev->ddev);
1482
1483 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_tv_std_enum_list);
1484 rdev->mode_info.tv_std_property =
1485 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1486 "tv standard",
1487 radeon_tv_std_enum_list, sz);
1488
1489 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_underscan_enum_list);
1490 rdev->mode_info.underscan_property =
1491 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1492 "underscan",
1493 radeon_underscan_enum_list, sz);
1494
1495 rdev->mode_info.underscan_hborder_property =
1496 drm_property_create_range(rdev->ddev, 0,
1497 "underscan hborder", 0, 128);
1498 if (!rdev->mode_info.underscan_hborder_property)
1499 return -ENOMEM;
1500
1501 rdev->mode_info.underscan_vborder_property =
1502 drm_property_create_range(rdev->ddev, 0,
1503 "underscan vborder", 0, 128);
1504 if (!rdev->mode_info.underscan_vborder_property)
1505 return -ENOMEM;
1506
1507 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_audio_enum_list);
1508 rdev->mode_info.audio_property =
1509 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1510 "audio",
1511 radeon_audio_enum_list, sz);
1512
1513 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_dither_enum_list);
1514 rdev->mode_info.dither_property =
1515 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1516 "dither",
1517 radeon_dither_enum_list, sz);
1518
1519 sz = ARRAY_SIZE(radeon_output_csc_enum_list);
1520 rdev->mode_info.output_csc_property =
1521 drm_property_create_enum(rdev->ddev, 0,
1522 "output_csc",
1523 radeon_output_csc_enum_list, sz);
1524
1525 return 0;
1526}
1527
1528void radeon_update_display_priority(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1529{
1530 /* adjustment options for the display watermarks */
1531 if ((radeon_disp_priority == 0) || (radeon_disp_priority > 2)) {
1532 /* set display priority to high for r3xx, rv515 chips
1533 * this avoids flickering due to underflow to the
1534 * display controllers during heavy acceleration.
1535 * Don't force high on rs4xx igp chips as it seems to
1536 * affect the sound card. See kernel bug 15982.
1537 */
1538 if ((ASIC_IS_R300(rdev) || (rdev->family == CHIP_RV515)) &&
1539 !(rdev->flags & RADEON_IS_IGP))
1540 rdev->disp_priority = 2;
1541 else
1542 rdev->disp_priority = 0;
1543 } else
1544 rdev->disp_priority = radeon_disp_priority;
1545
1546}
1547
1548/*
1549 * Allocate hdmi structs and determine register offsets
1550 */
1551static void radeon_afmt_init(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1552{
1553 int i;
1554
1555 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_MAX_AFMT_BLOCKS; i++)
1556 rdev->mode_info.afmt[i] = NULL;
1557
1558 if (ASIC_IS_NODCE(rdev)) {
1559 /* nothing to do */
1560 } else if (ASIC_IS_DCE4(rdev)) {
1561 static uint32_t eg_offsets[] = {
1562 EVERGREEN_CRTC0_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1563 EVERGREEN_CRTC1_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1564 EVERGREEN_CRTC2_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1565 EVERGREEN_CRTC3_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1566 EVERGREEN_CRTC4_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1567 EVERGREEN_CRTC5_REGISTER_OFFSET,
1568 0x13830 - 0x7030,
1569 };
1570 int num_afmt;
1571
1572 /* DCE8 has 7 audio blocks tied to DIG encoders */
1573 /* DCE6 has 6 audio blocks tied to DIG encoders */
1574 /* DCE4/5 has 6 audio blocks tied to DIG encoders */
1575 /* DCE4.1 has 2 audio blocks tied to DIG encoders */
1576 if (ASIC_IS_DCE8(rdev))
1577 num_afmt = 7;
1578 else if (ASIC_IS_DCE6(rdev))
1579 num_afmt = 6;
1580 else if (ASIC_IS_DCE5(rdev))
1581 num_afmt = 6;
1582 else if (ASIC_IS_DCE41(rdev))
1583 num_afmt = 2;
1584 else /* DCE4 */
1585 num_afmt = 6;
1586
1587 BUG_ON(num_afmt > ARRAY_SIZE(eg_offsets));
1588 for (i = 0; i < num_afmt; i++) {
1589 rdev->mode_info.afmt[i] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_afmt), GFP_KERNEL);
1590 if (rdev->mode_info.afmt[i]) {
1591 rdev->mode_info.afmt[i]->offset = eg_offsets[i];
1592 rdev->mode_info.afmt[i]->id = i;
1593 }
1594 }
1595 } else if (ASIC_IS_DCE3(rdev)) {
1596 /* DCE3.x has 2 audio blocks tied to DIG encoders */
1597 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_afmt), GFP_KERNEL);
1598 if (rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]) {
1599 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]->offset = DCE3_HDMI_OFFSET0;
1600 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]->id = 0;
1601 }
1602 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_afmt), GFP_KERNEL);
1603 if (rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]) {
1604 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]->offset = DCE3_HDMI_OFFSET1;
1605 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]->id = 1;
1606 }
1607 } else if (ASIC_IS_DCE2(rdev)) {
1608 /* DCE2 has at least 1 routable audio block */
1609 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_afmt), GFP_KERNEL);
1610 if (rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]) {
1611 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]->offset = DCE2_HDMI_OFFSET0;
1612 rdev->mode_info.afmt[0]->id = 0;
1613 }
1614 /* r6xx has 2 routable audio blocks */
1615 if (rdev->family >= CHIP_R600) {
1616 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1] = kzalloc(sizeof(struct radeon_afmt), GFP_KERNEL);
1617 if (rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]) {
1618 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]->offset = DCE2_HDMI_OFFSET1;
1619 rdev->mode_info.afmt[1]->id = 1;
1620 }
1621 }
1622 }
1623}
1624
1625static void radeon_afmt_fini(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1626{
1627 int i;
1628
1629 for (i = 0; i < RADEON_MAX_AFMT_BLOCKS; i++) {
1630 kfree(rdev->mode_info.afmt[i]);
1631 rdev->mode_info.afmt[i] = NULL;
1632 }
1633}
1634
1635int radeon_modeset_init(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1636{
1637 int i;
1638 int ret;
1639
1640 drm_mode_config_init(rdev->ddev);
1641 rdev->mode_info.mode_config_initialized = true;
1642
1643 rdev->ddev->mode_config.funcs = &radeon_mode_funcs;
1644
1645 if (ASIC_IS_DCE5(rdev)) {
1646 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_width = 16384;
1647 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_height = 16384;
1648 } else if (ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev)) {
1649 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_width = 8192;
1650 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_height = 8192;
1651 } else {
1652 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_width = 4096;
1653 rdev->ddev->mode_config.max_height = 4096;
1654 }
1655
1656 rdev->ddev->mode_config.preferred_depth = 24;
1657 rdev->ddev->mode_config.prefer_shadow = 1;
1658
1659 rdev->ddev->mode_config.fb_base = rdev->mc.aper_base;
1660
1661 ret = radeon_modeset_create_props(rdev);
1662 if (ret) {
1663 return ret;
1664 }
1665
1666 /* init i2c buses */
1667 radeon_i2c_init(rdev);
1668
1669 /* check combios for a valid hardcoded EDID - Sun servers */
1670 if (!rdev->is_atom_bios) {
1671 /* check for hardcoded EDID in BIOS */
1672 radeon_combios_check_hardcoded_edid(rdev);
1673 }
1674
1675 /* allocate crtcs */
1676 for (i = 0; i < rdev->num_crtc; i++) {
1677 radeon_crtc_init(rdev->ddev, i);
1678 }
1679
1680 /* okay we should have all the bios connectors */
1681 ret = radeon_setup_enc_conn(rdev->ddev);
1682 if (!ret) {
1683 return ret;
1684 }
1685
1686 /* init dig PHYs, disp eng pll */
1687 if (rdev->is_atom_bios) {
1688 radeon_atom_encoder_init(rdev);
1689 radeon_atom_disp_eng_pll_init(rdev);
1690 }
1691
1692 /* initialize hpd */
1693 radeon_hpd_init(rdev);
1694
1695 /* setup afmt */
1696 radeon_afmt_init(rdev);
1697
1698 radeon_fbdev_init(rdev);
1699 drm_kms_helper_poll_init(rdev->ddev);
1700
1701 /* do pm late init */
1702 ret = radeon_pm_late_init(rdev);
1703
1704 return 0;
1705}
1706
1707void radeon_modeset_fini(struct radeon_device *rdev)
1708{
1709 radeon_fbdev_fini(rdev);
1710 kfree(rdev->mode_info.bios_hardcoded_edid);
1711
1712 if (rdev->mode_info.mode_config_initialized) {
1713 radeon_afmt_fini(rdev);
1714 drm_kms_helper_poll_fini(rdev->ddev);
1715 radeon_hpd_fini(rdev);
1716 drm_mode_config_cleanup(rdev->ddev);
1717 rdev->mode_info.mode_config_initialized = false;
1718 }
1719 /* free i2c buses */
1720 radeon_i2c_fini(rdev);
1721}
1722
1723static bool is_hdtv_mode(const struct drm_display_mode *mode)
1724{
1725 /* try and guess if this is a tv or a monitor */
1726 if ((mode->vdisplay == 480 && mode->hdisplay == 720) || /* 480p */
1727 (mode->vdisplay == 576) || /* 576p */
1728 (mode->vdisplay == 720) || /* 720p */
1729 (mode->vdisplay == 1080)) /* 1080p */
1730 return true;
1731 else
1732 return false;
1733}
1734
1735bool radeon_crtc_scaling_mode_fixup(struct drm_crtc *crtc,
1736 const struct drm_display_mode *mode,
1737 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
1738{
1739 struct drm_device *dev = crtc->dev;
1740 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
1741 struct drm_encoder *encoder;
1742 struct radeon_crtc *radeon_crtc = to_radeon_crtc(crtc);
1743 struct radeon_encoder *radeon_encoder;
1744 struct drm_connector *connector;
1745 struct radeon_connector *radeon_connector __unused;
1746 bool first = true;
1747 u32 src_v = 1, dst_v = 1;
1748 u32 src_h = 1, dst_h = 1;
1749
1750 radeon_crtc->h_border = 0;
1751 radeon_crtc->v_border = 0;
1752
1753 list_for_each_entry(encoder, &dev->mode_config.encoder_list, head) {
1754 if (encoder->crtc != crtc)
1755 continue;
1756 radeon_encoder = to_radeon_encoder(encoder);
1757 connector = radeon_get_connector_for_encoder(encoder);
1758 radeon_connector = to_radeon_connector(connector);
1759
1760 if (first) {
1761 /* set scaling */
1762 if (radeon_encoder->rmx_type == RMX_OFF)
1763 radeon_crtc->rmx_type = RMX_OFF;
1764 else if (mode->hdisplay < radeon_encoder->native_mode.hdisplay ||
1765 mode->vdisplay < radeon_encoder->native_mode.vdisplay)
1766 radeon_crtc->rmx_type = radeon_encoder->rmx_type;
1767 else
1768 radeon_crtc->rmx_type = RMX_OFF;
1769 /* copy native mode */
1770 memcpy(&radeon_crtc->native_mode,
1771 &radeon_encoder->native_mode,
1772 sizeof(struct drm_display_mode));
1773 src_v = crtc->mode.vdisplay;
1774 dst_v = radeon_crtc->native_mode.vdisplay;
1775 src_h = crtc->mode.hdisplay;
1776 dst_h = radeon_crtc->native_mode.hdisplay;
1777
1778 /* fix up for overscan on hdmi */
1779 if (ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev) &&
1780 (!(mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE)) &&
1781 ((radeon_encoder->underscan_type == UNDERSCAN_ON) ||
1782 ((radeon_encoder->underscan_type == UNDERSCAN_AUTO) &&
1783 drm_detect_hdmi_monitor(radeon_connector_edid(connector)) &&
1784 is_hdtv_mode(mode)))) {
1785 if (radeon_encoder->underscan_hborder != 0)
1786 radeon_crtc->h_border = radeon_encoder->underscan_hborder;
1787 else
1788 radeon_crtc->h_border = (mode->hdisplay >> 5) + 16;
1789 if (radeon_encoder->underscan_vborder != 0)
1790 radeon_crtc->v_border = radeon_encoder->underscan_vborder;
1791 else
1792 radeon_crtc->v_border = (mode->vdisplay >> 5) + 16;
1793 radeon_crtc->rmx_type = RMX_FULL;
1794 src_v = crtc->mode.vdisplay;
1795 dst_v = crtc->mode.vdisplay - (radeon_crtc->v_border * 2);
1796 src_h = crtc->mode.hdisplay;
1797 dst_h = crtc->mode.hdisplay - (radeon_crtc->h_border * 2);
1798 }
1799 first = false;
1800 } else {
1801 if (radeon_crtc->rmx_type != radeon_encoder->rmx_type) {
1802 /* WARNING: Right now this can't happen but
1803 * in the future we need to check that scaling
1804 * are consistent across different encoder
1805 * (ie all encoder can work with the same
1806 * scaling).
1807 */
1808 DRM_ERROR("Scaling not consistent across encoder.\n");
1809 return false;
1810 }
1811 }
1812 }
1813 if (radeon_crtc->rmx_type != RMX_OFF) {
1814 fixed20_12 a, b;
1815 a.full = dfixed_const(src_v);
1816 b.full = dfixed_const(dst_v);
1817 radeon_crtc->vsc.full = dfixed_div(a, b);
1818 a.full = dfixed_const(src_h);
1819 b.full = dfixed_const(dst_h);
1820 radeon_crtc->hsc.full = dfixed_div(a, b);
1821 } else {
1822 radeon_crtc->vsc.full = dfixed_const(1);
1823 radeon_crtc->hsc.full = dfixed_const(1);
1824 }
1825 return true;
1826}
1827
1828/*
1829 * Retrieve current video scanout position of crtc on a given gpu, and
1830 * an optional accurate timestamp of when query happened.
1831 *
1832 * \param dev Device to query.
1833 * \param crtc Crtc to query.
1834 * \param flags Flags from caller (DRM_CALLED_FROM_VBLIRQ or 0).
1835 * For driver internal use only also supports these flags:
1836 *
1837 * USE_REAL_VBLANKSTART to use the real start of vblank instead
1838 * of a fudged earlier start of vblank.
1839 *
1840 * GET_DISTANCE_TO_VBLANKSTART to return distance to the
1841 * fudged earlier start of vblank in *vpos and the distance
1842 * to true start of vblank in *hpos.
1843 *
1844 * \param *vpos Location where vertical scanout position should be stored.
1845 * \param *hpos Location where horizontal scanout position should go.
1846 * \param *stime Target location for timestamp taken immediately before
1847 * scanout position query. Can be NULL to skip timestamp.
1848 * \param *etime Target location for timestamp taken immediately after
1849 * scanout position query. Can be NULL to skip timestamp.
1850 *
1851 * Returns vpos as a positive number while in active scanout area.
1852 * Returns vpos as a negative number inside vblank, counting the number
1853 * of scanlines to go until end of vblank, e.g., -1 means "one scanline
1854 * until start of active scanout / end of vblank."
1855 *
1856 * \return Flags, or'ed together as follows:
1857 *
1858 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID = Query successful.
1859 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_INVBL = Inside vblank.
1860 * DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE = Returned position is accurate. A lack of
1861 * this flag means that returned position may be offset by a constant but
1862 * unknown small number of scanlines wrt. real scanout position.
1863 *
1864 */
1865int radeon_get_crtc_scanoutpos(struct drm_device *dev, unsigned int pipe,
1866 unsigned int flags, int *vpos, int *hpos,
1867 ktime_t *stime, ktime_t *etime,
1868 const struct drm_display_mode *mode)
1869{
1870 u32 stat_crtc = 0, vbl = 0, position = 0;
1871 int vbl_start, vbl_end, vtotal, ret = 0;
1872 bool in_vbl = true;
1873
1874 struct radeon_device *rdev = dev->dev_private;
1875
1876 /* preempt_disable_rt() should go right here in PREEMPT_RT patchset. */
1877
1878 /* Get optional system timestamp before query. */
1879 if (stime)
1880 *stime = ktime_get();
1881
1882 if (ASIC_IS_DCE4(rdev)) {
1883 if (pipe == 0) {
1884 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1885 EVERGREEN_CRTC0_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1886 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1887 EVERGREEN_CRTC0_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1888 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1889 }
1890 if (pipe == 1) {
1891 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1892 EVERGREEN_CRTC1_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1893 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1894 EVERGREEN_CRTC1_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1895 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1896 }
1897 if (pipe == 2) {
1898 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1899 EVERGREEN_CRTC2_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1900 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1901 EVERGREEN_CRTC2_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1902 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1903 }
1904 if (pipe == 3) {
1905 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1906 EVERGREEN_CRTC3_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1907 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1908 EVERGREEN_CRTC3_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1909 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1910 }
1911 if (pipe == 4) {
1912 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1913 EVERGREEN_CRTC4_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1914 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1915 EVERGREEN_CRTC4_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1916 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1917 }
1918 if (pipe == 5) {
1919 vbl = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END +
1920 EVERGREEN_CRTC5_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1921 position = RREG32(EVERGREEN_CRTC_STATUS_POSITION +
1922 EVERGREEN_CRTC5_REGISTER_OFFSET);
1923 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1924 }
1925 } else if (ASIC_IS_AVIVO(rdev)) {
1926 if (pipe == 0) {
1927 vbl = RREG32(AVIVO_D1CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END);
1928 position = RREG32(AVIVO_D1CRTC_STATUS_POSITION);
1929 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1930 }
1931 if (pipe == 1) {
1932 vbl = RREG32(AVIVO_D2CRTC_V_BLANK_START_END);
1933 position = RREG32(AVIVO_D2CRTC_STATUS_POSITION);
1934 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1935 }
1936 } else {
1937 /* Pre-AVIVO: Different encoding of scanout pos and vblank interval. */
1938 if (pipe == 0) {
1939 /* Assume vbl_end == 0, get vbl_start from
1940 * upper 16 bits.
1941 */
1942 vbl = (RREG32(RADEON_CRTC_V_TOTAL_DISP) &
1943 RADEON_CRTC_V_DISP) >> RADEON_CRTC_V_DISP_SHIFT;
1944 /* Only retrieve vpos from upper 16 bits, set hpos == 0. */
1945 position = (RREG32(RADEON_CRTC_VLINE_CRNT_VLINE) >> 16) & RADEON_CRTC_V_TOTAL;
1946 stat_crtc = RREG32(RADEON_CRTC_STATUS);
1947 if (!(stat_crtc & 1))
1948 in_vbl = false;
1949
1950 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1951 }
1952 if (pipe == 1) {
1953 vbl = (RREG32(RADEON_CRTC2_V_TOTAL_DISP) &
1954 RADEON_CRTC_V_DISP) >> RADEON_CRTC_V_DISP_SHIFT;
1955 position = (RREG32(RADEON_CRTC2_VLINE_CRNT_VLINE) >> 16) & RADEON_CRTC_V_TOTAL;
1956 stat_crtc = RREG32(RADEON_CRTC2_STATUS);
1957 if (!(stat_crtc & 1))
1958 in_vbl = false;
1959
1960 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_VALID;
1961 }
1962 }
1963
1964 /* Get optional system timestamp after query. */
1965 if (etime)
1966 *etime = ktime_get();
1967
1968 /* preempt_enable_rt() should go right here in PREEMPT_RT patchset. */
1969
1970 /* Decode into vertical and horizontal scanout position. */
1971 *vpos = position & 0x1fff;
1972 *hpos = (position >> 16) & 0x1fff;
1973
1974 /* Valid vblank area boundaries from gpu retrieved? */
1975 if (vbl > 0) {
1976 /* Yes: Decode. */
1977 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_ACCURATE;
1978 vbl_start = vbl & 0x1fff;
1979 vbl_end = (vbl >> 16) & 0x1fff;
1980 }
1981 else {
1982 /* No: Fake something reasonable which gives at least ok results. */
1983 vbl_start = mode->crtc_vdisplay;
1984 vbl_end = 0;
1985 }
1986
1987 /* Called from driver internal vblank counter query code? */
1988 if (flags & GET_DISTANCE_TO_VBLANKSTART) {
1989 /* Caller wants distance from real vbl_start in *hpos */
1990 *hpos = *vpos - vbl_start;
1991 }
1992
1993 /* Fudge vblank to start a few scanlines earlier to handle the
1994 * problem that vblank irqs fire a few scanlines before start
1995 * of vblank. Some driver internal callers need the true vblank
1996 * start to be used and signal this via the USE_REAL_VBLANKSTART flag.
1997 *
1998 * The cause of the "early" vblank irq is that the irq is triggered
1999 * by the line buffer logic when the line buffer read position enters
2000 * the vblank, whereas our crtc scanout position naturally lags the
2001 * line buffer read position.
2002 */
2003 if (!(flags & USE_REAL_VBLANKSTART))
2004 vbl_start -= rdev->mode_info.crtcs[pipe]->lb_vblank_lead_lines;
2005
2006 /* Test scanout position against vblank region. */
2007 if ((*vpos < vbl_start) && (*vpos >= vbl_end))
2008 in_vbl = false;
2009
2010 /* In vblank? */
2011 if (in_vbl)
2012 ret |= DRM_SCANOUTPOS_IN_VBLANK;
2013
2014 /* Called from driver internal vblank counter query code? */
2015 if (flags & GET_DISTANCE_TO_VBLANKSTART) {
2016 /* Caller wants distance from fudged earlier vbl_start */
2017 *vpos -= vbl_start;
2018 return ret;
2019 }
2020
2021 /* Check if inside vblank area and apply corrective offsets:
2022 * vpos will then be >=0 in video scanout area, but negative
2023 * within vblank area, counting down the number of lines until
2024 * start of scanout.
2025 */
2026
2027 /* Inside "upper part" of vblank area? Apply corrective offset if so: */
2028 if (in_vbl && (*vpos >= vbl_start)) {
2029 vtotal = mode->crtc_vtotal;
2030 *vpos = *vpos - vtotal;
2031 }
2032
2033 /* Correct for shifted end of vbl at vbl_end. */
2034 *vpos = *vpos - vbl_end;
2035
2036 return ret;
2037}
